items.title: Ex-Zomato COO launches aerospace startup LAT
items.author: Surobhi Das, Deepinder Goyal
items.summary:
- Former Zomato COO, Surobhi Das, launches LAT Aerospace, focusing on low-cost regional air travel.
- Zomato CEO, Deepinder Goyal, joins as a non-executive cofounder and invests US$20 million.
- LAT Aerospace is developing STOL aircraft with a range of 1,500 km and a capacity for 24 passengers.
- The startup is in stealth mode and plans to create compact 'air-stops' needing minimal airport infrastructure.

items.title: China’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- China has transformed from low-end manufacturing to high-tech innovation.
- Major companies like Alibaba and Tencent have emerged as industry leaders.
- The article discusses potential future leaders in the Chinese tech industry with the aid of a funding tracker.
- A subscription is required to access the full content and visuals of the article.

items.title: Defense tech firm Shield AI appoints new CEO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Shield AI appointed Gary Steele as CEO effective May 13.
- Steele, previously CEO of Splunk Inc., was acquired by Cisco for US$28 billion in 2023.
- He succeeds Ryan Tseng, co-founder of Shield AI, who will remain as president.

items.title: Capital A to sell BigPay’s majority stake
items.summary:
- Capital A plans to sell a majority stake in its fintech arm, BigPay, to an undisclosed large regional bank.
- The announcement was made by CEO Tony Fernandes on Mar. 12, 2025, citing capital requirements.
- BigPay is the only loss-making entity among Capital A's non-aviation businesses and negotiations are ongoing with several fintech and global players.
- Capital A intends to retain a 30% stake in BigPay post-sale.

items.title: Swedish EV battery firm Northvolt files for bankruptcy
items.summary:
- Northvolt filed for bankruptcy on March 12, 2025, after facing significant financial challenges.
- Key factors included rising capital costs, geopolitical instability, supply chain disruptions, and fluctuating demand.
- The company also struggled with production ramp-up issues and liquidity, despite some financial support from lenders.

items.title: Saudi, South Korea aerospace agencies team up on space tech
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia and South Korea's aerospace agencies collaborate on advances in space technology.
- The partnership aims to enhance capabilities in satellite development and launch systems.
- The collaboration underscores the growing importance of space exploration in international relations.

items.title: Indian travel firm Yatra’s CFO resigns for new opportunities
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Yatra’s CFO Rohan Mittal has resigned to pursue new opportunities.
- The resignation was announced during a board meeting on Mar. 12, with his resignation submitted on Mar. 10.
- His final working day will be determined through mutual discussions for a smooth transition.
- Mittal joined Yatra in 2022 and has prior experience as CFO at Rivigo and AllcargoGATI.
- He holds an MBA from IIM Lucknow and has worked with PwC India and ICICI Bank.

items.title: Microsoft to open first Indonesia data center by Q2 2025
items.summary:
- Microsoft plans to open its first data center in Indonesia named the Indonesia Central Cloud Region by Q2 2025.
- The data center, under construction since 2021, will be part of Microsoft's global network of over 60 cloud regions.
- It's expected to create over 106,000 jobs across various sectors including manufacturing, finance, government, and communications.
- This initiative is part of a US$1.7 billion investment announced in 2024 by CEO Satya Nadella.
- The data center underscores Microsoft’s commitment to cloud and AI development in Indonesia.

items.title: Supabase developer platform raises $100m, valued at $2b
items.summary:
- Supabase Inc. has raised over $100 million, valuing the company at approximately $2 billion.
- The funding round is led by venture capital firm Accel, both of whom declined to comment on the matter.
- Founded in 2020, Supabase serves as an open-source alternative to Google’s Firebase, helping over 450,000 registered developers scale their projects effectively.

items.title: VC funds tracker: latest on Bessemer Venture Partners
items.summary:
- Fundraising is challenging; a list of VC funds raised in Southeast Asia and India is compiled for easier access.
- Over US$1.8 billion in investment vehicles launched for 2025, with 77 funds raising almost US$17 billion in 2024.
- Notable trends include sector-agnostic investors and a rise in AI-focused funds from 4 to 12, raising US$3.9 billion.
- Southeast Asia is ahead of India in both fund count and funding amount over the past four years.
- VCs are primarily based in Southeast Asia, with a focus on early-stage companies despite late-stage funding still occurring.

items.title: Indian wearables startup Noise expands into GCC region
items.author: Gaurav Khatri, Amit Khatri
items.summary:
- Noise, an Indian audio and wearables startup, expands into the GCC region for international growth.
- Partnership with Dubai-based Lime Concepts enables this expansion.
- Noise's products will be sold at Virgin Mega Stores in the GCC, marking its first global expansion step.
- Founded in 2014 by Gaurav and Amit Khatri, Noise initially focused on smartphone accessories before transitioning to wearables and audio products.

items.title: Malaysian chipmaker firm SkyeChip targets $226m IPO valuation
items.summary:
- Semiconductor designer SkyeChip plans an initial public offering (IPO) in Malaysia, potentially in the second half of 2025.
- The company, founded in 2019, aims for a valuation of over 1 billion ringgit (US$226 million).
- The IPO aligns with Malaysia’s initiative to expand its semiconductor sector, including a US$250 million agreement with SoftBank’s Arm Holdings to enhance domestic chip design.
- Malaysia’s IPO market raised US$1.6 billion in 2024, the highest since 2017.

items.title: Xiaohongshu launches cross-border ecommerce program
items.summary:
- Xiaohongshu has launched the “Overseas Ecommerce Pioneer Program” to offer cross-border business solutions for merchants.
- The program integrates online transactions, export trade, cross-border payments, and localized operations.
- Currently in testing phase, available by invitation only to select merchants.
- Initial target markets include the US, Hong Kong, and Macau.
- Merchants can check their invitation status through Baidu’s Qianfan platform, with public applications not yet open.

items.title: UK warns Apple, Google over browser dominance
items.summary:
- The UK’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) highlights issues in the mobile browser market dominated by Apple and Google.
- The investigation found that the current ecosystem is ineffective for both consumers and businesses.
- Inquiry initiated in January, focusing on Safari (88% usage on Apple devices) and Chrome (77% usage on Android in 2024).

items.title: Food delivery startup Wonder acquires media firm Tastemade
items.summary:
- Wonder, a food delivery startup, has acquired the media firm Tastemade.
- The acquisition aims to enhance Wonder's platform by integrating Tastemade's culinary content.
- This move reflects the growing trend of food delivery services expanding into multimedia content to engage users.

items.title: TSMC proposes joint venture to manage Intel foundry
items.summary:
- TSMC is in discussions with Nvidia, AMD, and Broadcom for a joint venture to operate Intel’s foundry division.
- TSMC would manage the foundry with no more than a 50% stake to keep majority ownership in the US.
- The joint venture needs US government approval to ensure Intel’s intellectual property remains under domestic control.
- This initiative is a response to the US government's requests for TSMC’s assistance with Intel’s manufacturing capabilities.
- Discussions are currently in preliminary stages, marking TSMC’s first approach to engage major semiconductor players.

items.title: Xiaomi denies mass production of CyberOne humanoid robot
items.summary:
- Xiaomi refutes reports of its humanoid robot CyberOne entering mass production.
- The company claims the circulating information is inaccurate.
- CyberOne was unveiled in August 2022 and features 21-joint coordination and a peak torque of 300 Nm.

items.title: Chinese EV brands lead global sales
items.summary:
- Global sales of EVs and hybrids reached 1.2 million units in February 2025, a 50% increase from February 2024.
- China accounted for approximately three-quarters of these sales, with a 76% increase in EV sales.
- Key brands like BYD, Xiaomi, Xpeng, and Zeekr launched new models transitioning from hybrids to fully electric cars.
- In the first two months of 2025, China’s EV sales grew by 35% to 1.4 million units, representing 60% of global sales.
- Plug-in hybrid vehicles saw slower growth at 22% compared to the previous year.

items.title: Spotify’s payouts reach $10b in 2024
items.summary:
- On Mar.12, 2025, Spotify reported it paid US$10 billion in royalties in 2024.
- This is the largest annual payout by the streaming service to date.
- Royalties increased from US$1 billion in 2014, with nearly 1,500 artists earning over US$1 million each in 2024.
- Spotify faced legal challenges last year, including a dismissed lawsuit regarding underpayment of songwriting royalties.

items.title: OpenAI launches new tools to build advanced AI agents
items.summary:
- OpenAI has launched new tools for developers and businesses to create AI agents for complex tasks.
- New offerings include a Responses API, Agents SDK, built-in tools, and integrated observability features.
- The Responses API combines Chat Completions and Assistants APIs, enabling web and file search integration.
- The tools aim to enhance accessibility and simplify workflows for developers.

items.title: Binance nets $2b UAE-based MGX deal, largest crypto investment
items.summary:
- UAE state-owned investment firm MGX announces a $2 billion investment in Binance, marking its first institutional investment.
- The investment will be made entirely in stablecoins, with no specific details on stake size or stablecoin type disclosed.
- MGX, launched by Abu Dhabi, enters the cryptocurrency sphere after previously focusing on AI and partnering with BlackRock and Microsoft.
- Binance is expanding its presence in the Middle East, employing around 1,000 people in the UAE and having over 260 million registered users.
- The UAE aims to solidify its position as a crypto hub in line with its technological leadership goals.

items.title: Nio lays off staff across key departments
items.summary:
- Nio has implemented layoffs in various departments, including after-sales service and PT Energy.
- Approximately 10% of the workforce is estimated to be affected, with regional variations; some departments faced up to 50% cuts.
- Affected employees were offered compensation and reassignment plans, with some moving to Xiaomi’s car user service team.
- The layoff notification process was swift, with some employees completing handovers in just 20 minutes.

items.title: South Korea to release institutional crypto investment rules
items.summary:
- South Korea’s Financial Services Commission (FSC) will release guidelines for institutional cryptocurrency investments by Q3 2025.
- Guidelines for non-profits and crypto exchanges will be available in April, with those for public companies and professional investors to follow in Q3.
- The FSC aims to gradually lift the ban on institutional crypto investments, starting with universities and charities.
- The guidelines will address trading, disclosure, and reporting standards, and will emphasize anti-money laundering and cybersecurity measures.
- The government is also working on the second phase of its crypto regulatory framework, focusing on stablecoins and crypto business regulations.
- As of November 2024, about 15.6 million South Koreans, or 30% of the population, are involved in crypto trading.

items.title: Flipkart co-founder starts Indian venture for branded goods
items.author: Binny Bansal
items.summary:
- Binny Bansal, co-founder of Flipkart, has launched a new venture named Opptra, based in Singapore.
- Opptra focuses on franchising branded consumer goods, targeting the middle class in India, Southeast Asia, and the Middle East, selling fashion, electronics, and kitchenware online.
- The company is gaining traction with brands like US Polo Association and Nautica in the Middle East.
- Formed with Bansal’s personal funds six months ago, Opptra currently employs 50 staff and plans to quadruple its workforce.
- The venture aims for US$100 million in revenue within 18 months and is utilizing AI for various operational improvements.

items.title: China’s ICBC launches $11.04b tech fund
items.summary:
- The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) has launched a technology fund worth 80 billion yuan (US$11.04 billion).
- Announced on March 12, the fund targets sectors like semiconductors and advanced manufacturing.
- The initiative is part of efforts to strengthen private enterprises and promotes a focus on long-term development through "patient capital."

items.title: As US turns tepid, Asia’s climate tech sector seeks new funders
items.author: Kevin Junker
items.summary:
- Kevin Junker, CEO of SmartSolar, highlights difficulties in raising funds amid changes in US climate policies under Trump.
- Climate tech funding in the US dropped by 40% in 2024, amounting to $50.7 billion, lowest since 2021.
- Startups in India and Southeast Asia also faced funding declines of 33% and 12% respectively, leading to uncertainty in new fundraising efforts.
- Investors predict family offices and corporations will step in to fill funding gaps left by US investors.
- The EU’s new policy requires companies to address environmental risks, influencing Asian partners to adopt sustainable practices.

items.title: AI drug startup Insilico nets $110m series E
items.summary:
- Insilico Medicine raised US$110 million in series E funding, valuing the company at over US$1 billion.
- The funding was led by Value Partners Group, with participation from Warburg Pincus, OrbiMed Advisors, and Eli Lilly & Co.
- Funds will enhance Insilico’s AI platform and support clinical development of Rentosertib for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, which has completed Phase IIa trials.
- Insilico has a pipeline of 30 drug assets, with 10 approved by the US FDA for investigational use.
- They conduct chemical synthesis in China, while advanced trials are conducted in the US.
- The company has secured contracts worth about US$3.5 billion by licensing assets to firms like Fosun Pharma and Exelixis.
- Insilico is developing advanced AI systems and humanoid robots to automate lab processes.

items.title: Alibaba launches AI model for emotion, visual analysis
items.author: Jiaxing Zhao
items.summary:
- Alibaba Group has launched R1-Omni, an AI model for assessing emotional states from videos and describing clothing and surroundings.
- Developed by researchers at Tongyi Lab, it builds on the open-source HumanOmni model.
- R1-Omni is available for free download on Hugging Face.
- This launch follows Alibaba's increased investment in AI and partnerships for AI features, including with Apple.
- CEO Eddie Wu emphasized the company's focus on artificial general intelligence.

items.title: French publishers, authors sue Meta over AI copyright
items.summary:
- France's leading publishing and authors' organizations have filed a lawsuit against Meta, alleging unauthorized use of protected content in its generative AI systems.
- The lawsuit was announced on Mar. 12, 2025, by the National Publishing Union (SNE), the National Union of Authors and Composers (SNAC), and the Society of Men of Letters (SGDL).
- Meta has not yet responded to the allegations.

items.title: Delta Air Lines software provider firm raises $82m series B
items.summary:
- Ditto, a San Francisco-based software company, raised $82 million in its series B funding round, increasing its valuation to $462 million.
- The funding round was led by Top Tier Capital Partners and Acrew Capital, with contributions from additional firms.
- Ditto's valuation more than doubled since its series A in 2023, and its annual recurring revenue grew by 250% as its customer base expanded.
- Founded in 2018, Ditto focuses on data synchronization between edge devices and the cloud.
- Its SDK utilizes Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and LAN for peer-to-peer networks, enabling applications to communicate without central cloud reliance.
- Major customers include Delta Air Lines, Japan Airlines, and Lufthansa, who benefit from Ditto’s technology in low-connectivity areas.
- The company plans to use the new funding to expand its team, enhance core products, and forge partnerships with cloud database providers.

items.title: Indian energy storage startup bags $5m
items.author: Ayush Misra, Rahul Shelke, Harshal Thakur, Neehar Jathar
items.summary:
- Pune-based AmpereHour Energy has secured $5 million in Series A funding.
- Investment was led by Avaana Capital, with participation from UC Impower and angel investors.
- Funds will be used to scale energy storage systems, enhance manufacturing, and expand product portfolio.

items.title: Spotify paid nearly 1,500 artists over $1m each in 2024: report
items.summary:
- Almost 1,500 artists earned over US$1 million in royalties from Spotify in 2024, according to a report released on Mar. 13.
- More than 80% of these artists did not appear on the Global Daily Top 50 Chart.
- Artists typically need around 4 to 5 million monthly listeners to earn over US$1 million, resulting in 20 to 25 million streams.
- Success on Spotify is achievable without a large back catalog or chart-topping hits.
- The number of artists earning over US$10 million in royalties increased by 600% since 2017.

items.title: How video analytics can transform industries
items.summary:
- Video analytics is revolutionizing various industries by providing data-driven insights.
- Key applications include security surveillance, retail, transportation, and sports.
- The technology enhances operational efficiency, customer experience, and decision-making processes.

items.title: Indonesian agritech firm Elevarm nets $4.25m pre-series A
items.summary:
- Indonesian agritech company Elevarm has secured $4.25 million in a pre-series A funding round led by Intudo, alongside Insignia Ventures Partners and 500 Global.
- The funding will be used to develop new agricultural inputs, expand seedling options, and launch AI-driven digital tools to enhance farming practices.
- Founded in 2022, Elevarm focuses on horticulture production and provides agricultural inputs such as seeds, bio-based fertilizers, and eco-friendly pest control solutions.
- The company operates in West Java, Central Java, and Yogyakarta, claiming to support over 15,000 farmers.

items.title: UAE-based wellness firm Longevity raises $4m for expansion
items.summary:
- UAE wellness company Longevity has successfully raised $4 million in funding.
- The investment aims to facilitate the company's expansion efforts.
- The funding round reflects growing interest in wellness and health-related services in the region.

items.title: DeepSeek denies rumors about R2 model launch
items.summary:
- DeepSeek has denied rumors of launching its R2 model on Mar. 17.
- The official statement clarified that the release date was inaccurate and no official date or details for R2 have been announced.
- Previous reports suggested DeepSeek was accelerating development, moving the launch up from May and indicating improvements in code generation and multilingual reasoning.

items.title: Ola Electric cuts costs by $10.3m per month
items.summary:
- Ola Electric reduces monthly cash burn by 90 crore rupees (approx. US$10.3 million).
- Cost-cutting program, named ‘Network Transformation and Opex Reduction Program’, was launched in November 2024.
- Measures include closing all regional warehouses and direct shipping from factories to stores.

items.title: Cybersecurity firm Pentera secures $60m series D
items.summary:
- Pentera raised $60 million in a Series D funding round, its first since early 2022.
- Last valuation over $1 billion after a $150 million Series C round.
- Led by Evolution Equity Partners, with participation from Farallon Capital Management.
- Total capital raised by Pentera now stands at $250 million.
- Founded in 2015, focusing on automated penetration testing and cyber defense validation.
- Plans to use funds for US market expansion and exploring mergers and acquisitions.

items.title: Indian chemical manufacturing startup raises $40m series B
items.author: Santosh Srivastava, Salil Srivastava
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based startup Scimplify raised $40 million in Series B funding.
- Investment co-led by Accel and Bertelsmann Investments; existing investors also participated.
- Total capital raised by Scimplify now stands at $54 million, aimed to expand operations in 16 markets.
- Plans to enhance services in life sciences, crop sciences, and industrial chemicals.
- Founded in 2023, Scimplify provides a B2B platform for sourcing and manufacturing specialty chemicals.

items.title: UAE’s MGX expands in US with key AI hires
items.summary:
- MGX, an Abu Dhabi-based investment firm, is expanding in the US with new hires from Apollo Global Management and Warburg Pincus.
- Andy Pickens has been appointed as managing director and AI product lead in MGX’s New York office.
- David Mamikonyan is named chief security officer, and Emilio Mena Jr. is managing director for the legal team.

items.title: Solar financing platform Okapi secures $2m in debt funding
items.summary:
- Okapi Technologies has secured a debt facility of up to US$2 million from Aquila, an IoT-focused sustainable finance company.
- The funding is aimed at promoting residential solar adoption among homeowners and small businesses in Malaysia and nearby regions.
- The company plans to utilize the new funding to support growth in Malaysia and Southeast Asia, with emphasis on financing engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contractors.

items.title: Saudi-backed Scopely acquires Pokémon Go maker for $3.5b
items.summary:
- Scopely Inc. has agreed to acquire Niantic Inc.’s gaming division for $3.5 billion.
- The acquisition includes the mobile game Pokémon Go and other titles like Pikmin Bloom and Monster Hunter Now.
- Scopely was purchased by Savvy Games Group, a subsidiary of Saudi Arabia’s PIF, for $4.9 billion in 2023.

items.title: EWA startups at a crossroads as scaling gets brutal
items.summary:
- EWA startups face challenges in scaling due to market conditions.
- Increasing competition and economic pressures are impacting growth.
- Need for adaptation and innovative strategies to overcome current obstacles.

items.title: Israeli mental healthtech startups raise $123m
items.summary:
- Significant growth in Israel’s mental health technology sector with a focus on trauma and resilience.
- Private investment rose by 66% in 2024, totaling US$123 million.
- A 2025 landscape map shows around 120 Israeli companies working on mental health solutions using AI and digital platforms.
- Approximately 85% of these startups are in early development stages, indicating the need for ongoing funding.

items.title: Lotus Cars appoints new China president
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Lotus Cars has appointed Peiji Qin as the new president of its operations in China as of March 12.
- Qin reports directly to CEO Feng Qingfeng and has over 15 years of experience in the Geely ecosystem, including roles at Volvo, Geely, and Polestar.
- Former president Mao Jingbo is now the global chief sales officer, overseeing global production, sales coordination, and marketing resource integration.
- The leadership changes are aimed at enhancing Lotus’ presence in the Chinese market and supporting global brand development and expansion efforts.

items.title: China summons Walmart over supplier pricing cut amid tariffs
items.summary:
- China summoned Walmart executives for regulatory talks on March 11 regarding pricing pressures on Chinese suppliers.
- Concerns arise about Walmart pushing suppliers to lower prices amid U.S. tariffs affecting financial burdens.
- The discussions may lead to further action before upcoming bilateral trade negotiations due to increasing economic tensions.

items.title: GoTo’s Q4 losses narrow to $56m as adjusted EBITDA surges
Omnia acquires AI-driven AR startup SpotKwik
items.summary:
- Omnia, a United States-based extended reality firm, acquires SpotKwik, an acclaimed augmented reality startup.
- The financial details of the acquisition remain undisclosed.
- SpotKwik, founded in 2019, originally focused on B2C social commerce through AR in influencer marketing, then shifted to a B2B model.
- Co-founder and CEO Mithun Adith highlights the partnership's aim to transition from mobile computing to spatial computing.

items.title: From Test to T20: India’s unicorn game
Bessemer Venture Partners launches $350m fund for Indian startups
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Bessemer Venture Partners has launched its second dedicated India fund worth US$350 million.
- The fund focuses on early-stage startups in sectors such as AI, SaaS, fintech, digital health, consumer brands, and cybersecurity.
- The firm has a nearly 20-year presence in Bangalore and has invested in over 80 Indian startups, including notable ones like BigBasket and Urban Company.
- Over 80% of Bessemer’s investments in India in the past five years have been at the series A stage or earlier.
- Vishal Gupta and Anant Vidur Puri will oversee the investment strategy in India.
